content.rendered:
Last night, I gave all of my worries to Jesus. It felt really good. It’s not the first time that I’ve trusted God with my fears, but I don’t do it nearly often enough. The first time was after a major military exam. I had just taken it that day, and the failure rate was high. I was worried, but I decided to give my worry to Jesus.

Maybe you have some worries of your own. I’ve learned to avoid watching television. There is a TV at work and, other than the weather, it’s mostly filled with death and misery and other things that I just don’t want to dwell on.

Now, it wouldn’t do any good to give Jesus my fears if I hadn’t first trusted him to take away my sins. The Bible tells us that we have all sinned. Romans 3: 23 KJV) tells us that “For all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God.” I could try to convince myself that I’m not really that bad a person, but that wouldn’t take away the fact that, by God’s standards, we are all sinners. Yet, God, who created us, the God who will one day judge his creation, made a way.

Acts 16:31 (KJV) tells us, “And they said, Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ, and thou shalt be saved, and thy house.” If we put our faith in Jesus who, tough he was equal with God, put on flesh to pay for our sins, then we will have eternal life. “That if thou shalt confess with thy mouth the Lord Jesus, and shalt believe in thine heart that God hath raised him from the dead, thou shalt be saved.” — Romans 10:9 (KJV)

It’s easy to forget, however, that the Bible also tells us, “casting all your care upon him; for he careth for you.” — 1 Peter 5:7 (KJV).

It is, perhaps, these cares that we carry are behind many of the problems that we face today: poor health, both mentally and physically, as well as a number of addictive behaviors. We may want to stop doing something, but it helps us forget our problems, so we keep doing it. What if, instead, we gave our problems to Jesus?

It’s too early to know the long term results. I may have to keep giving my cares to Jesus, but I can do that. You can, too.
